_README: This is a template for creating new blog posts. Copy the structure below (excluding this _README field) and add it to the 'posts' array in blog-posts.json
_INSTRUCTIONS: 1. Copy the template below. 2. Fill in all REQUIRED fields. 3. Optionally fill in optional fields. 4. Add to blog-posts.json. 5. Run 'node validate.js' to check for errors before deployment.
id: REQUIRED - Integer - Must be unique. Use next available number (current highest ID + 1)
title: REQUIRED - String - The blog post title. Keep under 100 characters for best display. Example: 'Top 10 Things to Do in Hoboken This Spring'
excerpt: REQUIRED - String - A brief summary of the post (2-3 sentences). Shows on listing page. Keep under 200 characters. Example: 'Discover the best spring activities in Hoboken, from waterfront walks to local dining. Perfect for your NYC getaway.'
content:
REQUIRED - String (HTML) - The main content of the blog post. Write in HTML format. Use

for major sections,

for subsections,

for paragraphs. Example structure:

Introduction Title

Introduction paragraph text here...

Main Section Title

Subsection 1

Content for subsection 1...

Subsection 2

Content for subsection 2...

Conclusion

Concluding paragraph...

Tips: - Use text for bold - Use text for italics - Use link text for links - Keep paragraphs concise (3-5 sentences) - Break content into scannable sections with headings
author: OPTIONAL - String - Default: 'Harmony Apartments' - Change if you have multiple authors. Example: 'John Smith' or 'Guest Writer'
date: REQUIRED - String (YYYY-MM-DD format) - Publication date. Must follow format exactly. Example: '2025-10-15' for October 15, 2025. Use today's date or schedule for future.
category: REQUIRED - String - Blog post category. Keep consistent. Current categories: 'Travel & Local', 'Events', 'Guides', 'Seasonal'. Choose existing or create new category. Example: 'Travel & Local'
image: OPTIONAL - String - Path to blog post featured image. Format: 'public/filename.jpg' - Upload image to /public folder first, then reference here. Use descriptive filenames. Example: 'public/spring-hoboken-2025.jpg'. Recommended image size: 1200x600px minimum, JPG format, optimized under 500KB.
